sub_topic: Identifying the hybridization of an atom in a molecule
message_1: What is the hybridization of the central atom in carbon dioxide (CO2)?
message_2: The hybridization of the central atom in carbon dioxide (CO2) is sp. In CO2, the central carbon atom forms two double bonds with two oxygen atoms. This requires two orbitals, which are formed by the hybridization of one s and one p orbital, resulting in an sp hybridization.
